oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The Normal Periparturient Cow
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Momont, Harry
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: periparturient
abnormal postpartum
managing reproduction
preventive
therapeutic
physiology
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Life would be a lot easier for all of us if cows could produce milk without getting pregnant. Parturition is truly a mixed blessing of opportunity and frustration for producers and their veterinarians. In perfect compliance with Murphy's law, the periparturient period is a time when everything can, and often does, go wrong. This presentation will focus on managing reproduction in the abnormal postpartum cow from both a preventive and therapeutic perspective. We begin with a review of normal periparturient physiology.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 1996; 1-2
